page.title: 13Two occupations
page.content: A wrought iron worker in Kirkandrews makes ornamental gates, name plates, plant holders and furniture such as bedheads. He also repairs agricultural machinery for local farmers. He is currently restoring two old steam tractors. His workshop is the original barn attached to a 1760 farm house. In the winter he maintains hedges and spreads fertiliser on his fields which he 'lets' for grazing. The local school kitchen assistant retired at Easter 1985 after 32 years' service which consisted of setting tables and supervising children eating. Afterwards she would clean the tables so that lessons could continue whilst she went back to Burgh school to wash the crockery.
